Description: Part of a foundation-deposit: rectangular lead plaque bearing an engraved vertical inscription on one side, to be read from right to left, of the cartouches (prenomen and nomen) of King Psamtek I. Although the item is heavily corroded the inscription is still visible, except on the lower part, where the object is broken.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", casemate building A, probably beneath the NE corner (or NW)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: see also PM IV, p. 7. See also Cairo, EM, JE 27385 & Boston, MFA, 87.528-529, 87.719-20, 87.653.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 54 § 52, p. 54-55 § 54, pl. xxii, 6, xxiii)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.53-54, p.175, pl.17, p.244, pl.86)
